XMVP.Story: { "title": "Concrete & Clover", "synopsis": "A seasoned detective, haunted by a case from his rural past, must navigate the treacherous world of high-finance crime when a seemingly simple embezzlement leads him back to the quiet town he swore he'd left behind, forcing him to confront the illusions of safety and the true cost of belonging.", "characters": [ "Detective Miles Corbin (Protagonist, City)", "Evelyn Hayes (Supporting, Country - Accountant)", "Julian Vance (Antagonist, City - Hedge Fund Manager)", "Sheriff Brody Miller (Supporting, Country - Local Law Enforcement)", "Clara Bellweather (Supporting, Country - Evelyn's Aunt, Town Historian)", "Marcus Thorne (Supporting, City - Corbin's Captain)", "Simone Archer (Supporting, City - Forensic Accountant)" ], "theme": "Hero's Journey" }
XMVP.Meta: { "source_file": "Ex_Nihilo_Project", "hj24_map": true, "parody": true, "genesis_mode": true, "atu_theme": "ATU 112: Country Mouse and City Mouse", "tlp_axiom": "(It is nonsense to place the hypothesis $p \\supset p$ before a proposition in order to ensure that its arguments have the right form, because the hypothesis for a non-proposition as argument becomes not false but meaningless, and because the proposition itself becomes senseless for arguments of the wrong kind, and therefore it survives the wrong arguments no better and no worse than the senseless hypothesis attached for this purpose.)" }
